revised_title: Determination of NMDA NR1 Subunit Stoichiometry in Recombinant NMDA Receptors
tldr: The authors used a method of co-expression of wild-type and mutated NMDA NR1 subunits in Xenopus oocytes to determine the stoichiometry of NMDA receptor-channel complexes. They found that there are likely to be two copies of the NR1 subunit in each NMDA receptor complex. This study provides insights into the subunit composition of NMDA receptors, which play a crucial role in fast excitatory neurotransmission in the central nervous system.
